intro: Cytisus banaticus, commonly known as the Banat shrub or Banat broom, is a deciduous shrub native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor soils and rocky areas. Cytisus banaticus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to prevent soil erosion.
